title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
short_description: A classic novel depicting the decadence of the Jazz Age in America.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
short_description: A powerful exploration of racial injustice in the American South during the 1930s.

author: George Orwell
short_description: A dystopian novel portraying a totalitarian society ruled by surveillance and oppression.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
short_description: A fantasy adventure novel following the journey of Bilbo Baggins to reclaim treasure guarded by a dragon.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
short_description: A classic novel exploring themes of love, reputation, and class in early 19th-century England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
short_description: A coming-of-age novel narrated by a disenchanted teenager, Holden Caulfield.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
short_description: A mystery thriller that follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he investigates a murder in the Louvre Museum.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
short_description: A landmark novel in magical realism, tracing the Buendía family over several generations in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
short_description: A philosophical novel about a young shepherd named Santiago on a journey to fulfill his personal legend.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
short_description: An epic fantasy trilogy that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron.
